Technique: CARVED; PAINTED; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Stela of Beh-ese
Description: Painted limestone slab forming an Apis stela. Underneath a winged sun disc, a man is kneeling in front of a bull resting on a stepped pedestal. The lower part of the stela features a prayer for offerings in six lines. The only colours used were red and black. The right edge and the lower part have broken away.
